the local area network is identified
with the help of MAC address only to
understand more about this we will take
an analogy IP addresses are like the
location of a person suppose if a person
is in Delhi his location is Delhi for
person is in Mumbai his location is
Mumbai if a person is in London his
location is London so IP addresses are
like the location of a person wherever
the person goes his location gets
changed but MAC addresses are like the
name of the person wherever he goes
his location may get changed but his
name will not get changed so that is
what the difference between an IP
address and a MAC address will see an
example now in this example we have many
n devices and many intermediary devices
suppose if this computer wants to send
some data to this computer and this
communication happens with the help of
both IP address and MAC address actually
routers need IP address and switches
need mark address for example this is
the source and it wants to send some
data to this receiver or the destination
with data it is going to send it is
going to add IP address and by
Petrus when the router receives this
packet it takes the forwarding decision
based on IP address once the data is
received by this switch and it is the
responsibility of the switch to deliver
the data to the light destination so
switch gives the data to the right
destination based on the MAC address so
IP addresses our router friendly
addresses and MAC addresses are switched
friendly addresses when any data wants
to be sent from any source to the
destination so switch takes the decision
based on the MAC address and router
takes the decision based on the IP
address and every switch will maintain a
MAC address table so that it knows to
which computer it has to forward which
computer has that corresponding MAC
address in a local area network we need
mark address in order to send the data
to the right destination we will now see
more about mark address we have already
seen every node in the local area
network is identified with the help of
MAC address and these mark addressed our
physical address or it can also be
called as Hardware address we know very
well that IP addresses our logical
address where can be changed but this
MAC addresses cannot be changed and it
will be normally unique throughout the
world so if you have a computer and that
computers mark address will not be given
to any computers mark undress in the
world at the same time these MAC
addresses cannot be changed why because
these mark addresses are assigned by the
manufacturer and the mark addresses are
represented in hexadecimal an example X
additional value that is the MAC address
is shown here 70 - 20 - 84 - 0 0 - II D
- f see this is an example MAC address
and this MAC address is all 48 bits and
this separator in the MAC address is
decided by the manufacturer and there
are separators like - periods or dots or
even colons so the manufacturer decides
which separated they want to use for
their MAC address representation we will
now see the difference between an IP
address and a MAC address so IP address
vs market
so IP address are definitely needed for
our communication obviously MAC address
is also needed for our communication and
IP addresses are of 32 bits whereas MAC
addresses are of 48 bits and we know
very well that IP addresses are
represented in decimal
whereas MAC addresses are represented in
hexadecimal router needs IP address to
forward the data whereas switch needs

after giving CMD the command prompt gets
